title: Ruptured Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
diagnosis_topic: Hemorrhagic shock from ruptured infrarenal AAA
setup_script: A 72-year-old man with a history of smoking and hypertension collapses at home. EMS finds him pale, diaphoretic and complaining of severe back and abdominal pain. He arrives hypotensive and tachycardic.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 80/50 mmHg, HR 120 bpm, RR 24/min, Temp 36.5 C, SpO2 95%.
Pulsatile abdominal mass, cool extremities, abdomen tender to palpation; no peritonitis but severe discomfort.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident initiates two large-bore IVs and transfusion
dynamic_flow.reply: BP improves to 90/60 mmHg after 1 unit PRBC.
Type and crossmatch, CBC shows Hgb 9 g/dL, BMP normal, lactate 5 mmol/L.
Focused bedside US reveals large infrarenal aneurysm with free fluid; CT angiography is not feasible due to hemodynamic instability.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident consults vascular surgery and activates OR
dynamic_flow.reply: Patient taken for emergent open repair or EVAR based on anatomy.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays to obtain CT
If resident asks about permissive hypotension
dynamic_flow.reply: Maintain systolic 80-90 mmHg to avoid dislodging clot prior to control.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident inquires about aortic cross-clamping
dynamic_flow.reply: Supracoeliac clamping may be needed to control bleeding.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident asks about postoperative care
dynamic_flow.reply: ICU with aggressive monitoring, renal perfusion management and risk of abdominal compartment syndrome.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident asks about risk factors
dynamic_flow.reply: Age, smoking, hypertension, male sex; screening recommended for certain populations.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discusses EVAR vs. open
dynamic_flow.reply: EVAR preferable if anatomy allows and resources available; open repair is definitive.

critical_decision_points: Recognition of ruptured AAA as surgical emergency
Resuscitation with permissive hypotension and blood products
Rapid coordination with vascular surgery team for repair
